intro: Euclea racemosa subsp. zuluensis, commonly known as the Zulu eucldea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
